title._content: På trilletur i Gamlebyen i Fredrikstad sommeren 1963

description._content:
På tur langs vollgravene. Gamle Fredrikstad var en festningsby og hadde et aktivt festningsverk helt til 1903. Etter at festningen var nedlagt, var det planer om å fylle ut vollgravene, planere de gamle festningsvollene og rive mye av bebyggelsen. Disse planene ble aldri realisert, i stedet meldte det seg en stadig økende interesse for å bevare stedets særpreg. Gamlebyen i Fredrikstad regnes i dag for Nord-Europas best bevarte festningsby.

PA-0797_3135film9006

Strolling in Fredrikstad's Old Town, summer of 1963
Walking along the moats. Old Fredrikstad was a fortress town and had an active fortification until 1903. After the fort was abandoned, there were plans to fill the moats, level the old ramparts and demolish many of the buildings. These plans were never realized. Instead there was an ever increasing interest in preserving the site's features. The Old Town in Fredrikstad is today Northern Europe's best preserved fortress town.
